noun.description: Any of the numerous small beetles constituting the subfamily Bruchinae (family Chrysomelidae), having larvae which develop within a single bean or seed. Also "bruchid beetle".

origin: Late 19th century. From scientific Latin Bruchus, genus name + -id, after scientific Latin Bruchidae, (former) family name (G. Samouelle Entomologist's Useful Compend 199, as alteration of earlier † Bruchides).
